oai_dc:dc.dc:title: FLUORESCENCE STUDIES ON ANTHRYL BACTERIORHODOPSINS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SINGH, AK
ROY, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: hydrogen-bonded chain
halobacterium-halobium
purple membrane

fluorescence
energy transfer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fluorescence properties of bacteriorhodopsin analogues containing 3-methyl-5-(9'-anthryl)-2E,4E-pentadienal and 3,7-dimethyl-9-(9'-anthryl)-2E,4E,6E,8E-nonatetraenal chromophores as built-in fluorescence probes are described. Determination of fluorescence quantum yields, fluorescence quenching and energy transfer efficiencies in terms of the Forster's energy transfer between tryptophans (Trp) and the anthrylidene moiety indicates that Trp residues lie at a critical distance (R(o)) of ca. 27 angstrom from the chromophore bound at Lys-216 on the apo-protein.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF PHOTOCHEMISTRY AND PHOTOBIOLOGY B-BIOLOGY, 8(3), 325-335
